channel.title: Victor Tam’s Podcast
channel.description: A podcast about technology and ideas shaping the world.
channel.itunes:author: Victor Tam

item.title: Episode 1 – The Global AI Revolution
item.description: An introduction to the global landscape of AI, its trends and implications.

item.title: Superflex Secrets: Joel Smyth's 2025 Draft Guide to QB Value, Rushing Upside, and Hidden Gems
item.description: Joel Smyth breaks down high-value QBs for your 2025 fantasy draft, highlighting rushing upside and deep sleeper picks.

item.title: The Atlantic: How Warren Buffett Did It
item.description: The most successful investor of all time is retiring. Here’s what made him an American role model.

item.title: Letter 236 – Josh Kushner and Alyson Shontell
item.description: Discussion with Josh Kushner and Fortune CEO Alyson Shontell about building, investing, and navigating modern business. Originally published via A Letter A Day.

item.title: #171 – Why E-Commerce Finally Looks Stable Again
item.description: Q3 2025 earnings point to an e-commerce sector regaining its footing, with disciplined growth, resilient demand, improving profitability, and early signs of AI shaping both discovery and supply. Consumer behavior remains value-oriented and bifurcated, while platforms like Amazon, Shopify, eBay, and The RealReal lean into focused execution and sober investment as the industry shifts from defense to offense heading into 2026.

item.title: The SaaS Bloodbath: Opportunities and Perils for Investors
item.description: Software stocks have fallen sharply in early 2026, with valuation multiples compressing across the sector. This episode examines whether the sell-off reflects structural disruption from AI or a market overreaction, introduces the “artificial limiters” framework for identifying defensible platforms, and explores why mission-critical SaaS may prove more resilient than feared. It also contrasts public-market opportunity with rising risk in venture investing during this AI transition.
